Class BlackJack

  • java.lang.Object
    • CardGame
      • BlackJack

  • public class BlackJack
extends CardGame
    Black Jack class extending from Abstract CardGame, implements the abstract methods menu() and play()

      • alterBalance

        public int alterBalance(int inc)
        This code alters the balance, handles case of no money or not enough money
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        altered balance of avaiable, -1 otherwise

        public void clearHand(java.util.ArrayList<Card> hand)
        Parameters:
        ArrayList - hand: hand array of specified cards clear card from array

      • handValue

        public int handValue(java.util.ArrayList<Card> hand)
        Parameters:
        ArrayList - hand: hand array of specified cards clear card from array
        Returns:
        int: totals up the rank value of the cards in the hand, ace counts as 1 or 11 based on the max upper limit of 21

      • sortHand

        public void sortHand(java.util.ArrayList<Card> hand)
        Parameters:
        ArrayList - hand, this is the hand that needs to be sorted Decreasing sort using comparable

      • play

        public void play()
        forced inheritance method from cardgame abstrac class, Scanner and console as I/O. Menu options and invalid options handling included. Betting of balance taken here as well.

      • computeWinner

        public void computeWinner(int player,
                          int computer,
                          int bet)
        Parameters:
        int - player: player total
        int - computer: dealer total
        int - bet: amount player is better computes winner and takes in account of the bet. If dealer wins bet is taken from from balance and if player wins bet is added to balance.

      • computerTurn

        public int computerTurn()
        Computing the computer/dealers turn.
        Returns:
        -1 or overflow or handValue() of the dealers hand after AI finishes drawing and holding. AI basic probability of forced < 17 value draw and handVaule() / MAX_VALUE prob of draw otherwise

      • playerTurn

        public int playerTurn()
        Returns:
        -1 or overflow or handValue() of the dealers hand Scanner Input for options for hitting more cards, player showed dealer hidden status hand and personal hand.

      • menu

        public void menu()
        Menu of the game, of of the methods force inherited form abstract class. Invalid inputs handled.
